Event.name: Kidnapping
Event.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe situations in which a <fen>Perpetrator</fen> carries off and holds the <fen>Victim</fen> against his or her will by force. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Perpetrator">Two men</fex> <t>kidnapped</t> <fex name="Victim">a Millwall soccer club employee</fex>, police said last night.</ex>
<ex>Not even the <t>abduction</t> <fex name="Victim">of his children</fex> <fex name="Perp">by Captain Hook and his scurvy sidekick, Smee</fex>, can shake Peter's scepticism.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Perpetrator
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) who carries off and holds the <fen>Victim</fen> against his or her will.</def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen> is the person who is carried off and held against his/her will.</def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the <fen>Victim</fen> before it changes location.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Goal</fen> is the place in which the <fen>Victim</fen> ends up.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Manner in which the kidnapping takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act performed by the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> that helps them accomplish the kidnapping.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> is what the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> hopes to accomplish by kidnapping.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> expresses why the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> commits the kidnapping.</def-root>

Arg.name: Co-participant
Arg.definition: <def-root>An additional abductee taken along with the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex>She was <t>abducted</t> <fex name="Co-participant">with her brother</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The period of time for which the <fen>Victim</fen> is held by the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>
<ex>Two young man <t>abducted</t> her <fex name="Duration">for about two hours</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The number of times that the <fen>Victim</fen> is kidnapped.
<ex> The prelate was <t>kidnapped</t> <fex name="Frequency">twice</fex> in the last two years</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: kidnap.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: abduct and hold captive, typically to obtain a ransom.

lexUnit.name: abduct.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take (someone) away illegally by force or deception.

lexUnit.name: shanghai.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: force to join a ship's crew by underhand means.

lexUnit.name: snatch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: steal or kidnap by seizing suddenly.

lexUnit.name: kidnapping.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of taking a person against their will, typically to obtain a ransom

lexUnit.name: abduction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action or condition of being taken away illegally by force or deception.

lexUnit.name: kidnapper.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: one who abducts and holds (someone) captive, typically to obtain a ransom.

lexUnit.name: abductor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the person who is taking away (someone) illegally by force or decption.

lexUnit.name: snatcher.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: one who steals or kidnaps by seizing suddenly.

lexUnit.name: kidnapped.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: abducted and held captive, typically for ransom.

lexUnit.name: abducted.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: taken away illegally by force or deception.
